His insider knowledge of the White Lotus (“They drink blood—plan blood… I know their lodge-room”) places him at the intersection of two clandestine groups: the Triad he belongs to and the White Lotus he fears. This dual connection embeds him within the larger web of secret societies operating behind the riots and trials, showing his actions are driven by personal stakes in these underground rivalries rather than mere happenstance.

The day had been so real, so wholesome, full of careless talk and of sunlight. And now this senseless picture blotted all else, and remained,--each outline sharper in memory, the smoky lamp brighter, the blow of the hilt louder, the smell of peanut oil more pungent.
